instruction: Develop a risk management strategy for our investment process that integrates risk across compliance, trading, and strategy development.
output:
Thank you for this task. Based on the information provided, an integrated risk management strategy should consider the different forms of risk across markets and opportunities and use a detailed and flexible quantitative risk framework to put them into a common context. It should also recognize that risk takes on a different role depending on the stage of the investment process and be integrated into all stages of the investment process. 

To accomplish this, we will need to identify the specific risks that apply to our investment process and assess their potential impact on our portfolio. We will also need to consider how we currently manage these risks and determine if any changes or improvements are necessary. By implementing a flexible quantitative risk framework, we can take a holistic view of our risk exposure and enable deliberate risk allocation across strategies. 

Furthermore, by integrating risk analytics into all stages of our investment process, we can more effectively navigate crises and capture unique opportunities in volatile markets. Ultimately, our risk management strategy should not just be defensive but allow us to proactively take advantage of market conditions.
